Detailed Description

This manages app domains and controls what app domains are created/destroyed.

Member Function Documentation

AppDomain Aurora.ScriptEngine.AuroraDotNetEngine.AppDomainManager.CreateRestrictedDomain ( string  permissionSetName,
string  appDomainName,
AppDomainSetup  ads 
)

Create an AppDomain that contains policy restricting code to execute with only the permissions granted by a named permission set.

From MRMModule.cs by Adam Frisby

Parameters:
permissionSetName name of the permission set to restrict to
appDomainName 'friendly' name of the appdomain to be created
Exceptions:
ArgumentNullException if permissionSetName is null
ArgumentOutOfRangeException if permissionSetName is empty
Returns:
AppDomain with a restricted security policy

Substantial portions of this function from: http://blogs.msdn.com/shawnfa/archive/2004/10/25/247379.aspx Valid permissionSetName values are: FullTrust SkipVerification Execution Nothing LocalIntranet Internet Everything
